page.title: 01HISTORY OF THE AREA 1891
page.content: IF WE ARE TO LOOK BACK IN HISTORY SOME ONE HUNDRED YEARS WE FIND THAT THE LAND FROM ITS VERY EARLY BEGINNINGS OF BELONGING TO THE CHURCH EVENTUALLY CAME INTO THE POSSESSION OF THE FOLLOWING PEOPLE. THE DUKE OF NEWCASTLE,LIEUT. COL.HENRY DENISON,WILLIAM HENRY MASON AND MR WILLIAM WALKER FROM RECORDS AVAILABLE TO US WE FIND THAT THE LAND IS SANDY LOAM; SUB SOIL SAND AND GRAVEL. THE CROPS ARE ARE CHIEFLY CEREALS AND ROOTS AND OVER 2OO ACRES OF THE PARISH IS WOODED THE PARISH (BABWORTH) CONTAINS 6190 ACRES; RATEABLE VALUE Â£10350 AND THE POPULATION WAS IN 1891,753.
